thread.title: Independent Eye back with its classic puppet staging of 'King Lear' at F
thread.title_full: Independent Eye back with its classic puppet staging of 'King Lear' at F

author: JANE HOLAHAN | Entertainment Reporter
title: Independent Eye back with its classic puppet staging of 'King Lear' at F
text:
Conrad Bishop and Elizabeth Fuller of The Independent Eye, return to Lancaster to perform their classic production of “King Lear” at the Green Room Theatre at Franklin & Marshall College on Monday, Oct. 19 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets are free. 
The production features 22 puppets. 
Bishop is Lear, a puppeteer who obsessively plays out his loss of power, friendship, shelter, sanity and even hope with his puppets. Fuller is the Fool, who torments Lear as she stage-manages his story. She also wrote the music score. +1 Conrad Bishop and Elizabeth Fuller in "MacBeth." 
The piece was first performed at F&M in 1978 and has toured a number of times since. 
Bishop and Fuller ran the Independent Eye theater in Lancaster through much of the 1980s. They are now based in California.
